revised_title: Thermochemistry and Reactivity of Inorganic Azides
tldr: The authors conducted a series of experiments to determine the thermochemistry and reactivity of inorganic azides, focusing on the enthalpies of formation and solution of various azides. They found that the standard enthalpy of formation of the aqueous azide ion is -228.6 kcal/mol, and the enthalpies of solution for alkali and alkaline-earth azides were measured. These findings provide a better understanding of the explosive nature and reactivity of azides.
